ovdesc.p: This table defines the default conditions for each Transaction Type which can be processed by the Funds Transfer and Standing Orders Application. These can be summarised as follows:
The Transaction Codes to be used for the generation of the entries. Both Debit and Credit Transaction Codes will be defined for basic entries, standing orders, debit charges and cheques.
The default Commission Types applicable for each Transaction Type. These Commission Types must first have been defined in the Commission Type table.
The default Charge Types applicable for each Transaction type. These Charge Types must have been previously created in the CHARGE.TYPE table.
Maximum Forward and Back Value Date
The Maximum Forward and Back Value dates applicable for each transaction type must be specified and any excess beyond these value dates will force an override at the transaction level.
Default Value Dates for the Accounting Entries

The default Value Date conditions may be held for each Transaction type. The conditions for both debit and credit entries are catered for, i.e the User can specify for each Transaction type, the Value Date conditions applicable to the bank and to the Customer.
For a given transaction type, the production of Debit and Credit advices by default, can be controlled.

The default conditions defined in this table will only be used by the Funds Transfer Application, during validation of the transaction, if specific values have not been manually entered during the transaction input stage.
Amendments to this table will only take effect after the user has next signed on to the system.

This record is used in FUNDS.TRANSFER to set field usage and options specific to a certain type of Funds Transfer. There are obvious differences between a simple Account Transfer and a fully detailed International Electronic Payment involving many counterparties so the options in each can differ and need unique options, this record allows those options to be configured as required.

Whilst there are standard codes which can be used (as detailed in the table below) it is also possible for the user to define custom codes. These can be up to 4 characters but must have the first 2 characters of one of the standard codes.
For example the code OT can be used for standard Outward Payments, whilst OTSW allows the option to specify BIC codes on and OT03 sends an MT103 instead of an MT100.

t.desc:
This field defines the maximum number of calendar days that the debit value date can be after the credit value date. The debit value date must not be after the credit value date plus the number of days defined in this field.
The number of days is defined as calendar days, not working days.
Standard processing in FT is that the debit value has to be before or equal to the credit value date. However, where FT is to be used to pass value date corrections, this restriction needs to be overriden. In order to allow debit value dates after the credit value date, the
DB.AFTER.CR field should be set to Yes. To limit any possible mistakes the number of days that the dates can differ should be entered in this field.
Validation Rules:
The input to this field is only allowed, when
DB.AFTER.CR is set to "YES".
Values of 1 to 99
Input is allowed for "AC" transaction types only.

desc.p: For OT type transactions it is possible to generate MT 100/202 payment messages for transfers between Nostro Accounts by entering the value of 202.
202 will enable the input of Beneficiary and Ordering fields in the Funds Transfer Application for transfers between Nostro Accounts.
The Value of 200 (or null) will generate MT200 messages as normal.
Must be OT transaction type. Permissable values 200 or 202. Input of this field for other than OT types will default to null. Optional input.

t.desc:
Where the bank has a need to pay funds to a client using only an account number, to maintain client confidentiality or other such reasons, this field will allow the input of just the beneficiary account number. Since this is not standard banking practise the default will be to require the beneficiary name with an optional account number.
Where this field is set to 'Yes' then if the transaction has only the beneficiary account number entered (in the
BEN.ACCT.NO field on the FUNDS.TRANSFER application) then no validation error will occur. The delivery message will be modified so that the beneficiary account number is mapped to the beneficary name in order that message is accepatable to SWIFT.
Validation Rules:
Values of Yes and No are permitted
Yes implies that beneficiary account alone is allowed
No or blank implies that the FT requires a beneficiary customer name or text.
Applies to outgoing transfers only (OT or first 2 characters OT).

This field allows the User to define special Customer Value Date conditions at the transaction level by specifying within Payment Type a number of days between the Value Date applied to Customer and the Value Date applicable to the bank. If zero '0' is input, the Customer will receive the Same day value as the bank itself.
Example:
INCOMING TRANSFER
DEBIT NOSTRO ACCOUNT (VALUE 15/1)
CUSTOMER FLOAT = 3 (15 plus 3 = 18)
CREDIT CUSTOMER ACCOUNT (VALUE 18/1)
OUTGOING TRANSFER
CREDIT NOSTRO ACCOUNT (VALUE 15/1)
CUSTOMER FLOAT = 2 (15 less 2 = 13)
DEBIT CUSTOMER ACCOUNT (VALUE 13/1)

0-9 = Number of working days to be added to the debit Value Date to make the credit Value Date for inward transfers and deducted from the credit Value Date to make the debit Value Date for outward transfers. or P = Processing date irrespective of the other Value Date. Associated multivalue field. (Mandatory input if Payment Type field has been input.)

(a) +/- If days are to be added to or, subtracted from, the Processing Date.
(bb) 01-99Indicates the number of days to be added/subtracted.
(c) C If (bb) are calendar days, or W If (bb) are working days.
If it is necessary to add or subtract any other days to those specified in (bb) before obtaining the default Payment Transfer Value Date then (d), (ee), (f) are used as follows:

CONV The conditions specified in the next three fields are only applicable to transactions involving conversion of Currencies.
NOCONV The conditions specified in the next three fields are only applicable to transactions not involving conversion of currencies.
